intro: Aglaia alternifoliola, commonly known as the narrow-leaf aglaia, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Meliaceae family, which includes mahogany and other valuable timber trees. The plant is characterized by its alternate, lance-shaped leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release winged seeds, aiding in its dispersal. Aglaia alternifoliola is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in local medicine.
